title: Potential event in Melbourne's South Eastern suburbs

embed.description: Want to see more eSporting events close to home? Have a strong desire to celebrate League of Legends with several thousand other gamers? We are seeking to determine interest in a sanctioned event with OCL and/or OCS teams? Complete this quick survey to lend your support and voice to help us prove to the powers that eSports is living strong in Melbourne's South-Eastern suburbs.

body:
Hey Team,

We are looking at trying to start a pro level event in Melbourne's south eastern suburbs (more specifically Pakenham) and are needing to determine the level of interest in the event, to get the concept off the ground.

If you could complete this quick survey [https://bit.ly/2DE4Xcn](https://bit.ly/2DE4Xcn) we can then prove to the power that be this event would be a success.

If you can also share this survey with you friends and wider community, the more interest and responses we get the bigger and better we can make the event.

replies.body:
Can you provide more information about said event? 

Am pretty sure this is a entrance fee type of thing, other wise how can you even pay the hosting cost. At least inform the people what they'll be buying into.

Also Pakenham is in the middle of no where, why are you hosting the event at such a hard to access location?? 

Sorry to say, but i think you guys are amateurs.

Thanks for the feedback - we are gauging interest in the event and so that we can provide our board with evidence that an event like this would actually attract an audience (they do understand eSports, like the vast majority of people). Before we lay down tens of thousands of dollars to get this event up and running I need to convince my board to approve it - hence, cannot provide you with more information on the event until I have a concrete yes.

The survey actually asks about ticket pricing - once you answer the first question (with a maybe or a yes). We chose to use this branching logic as if you would never be interested in attending an event out our way then you would never pay for it. Happily accept your feedback if you believe we should remove the branching logic and ask everyone to answer all questions - was trying to save some people time.

Yes, Pakenham 50KM out of Melbourne city, but still part of Melbourne metropolitan area - and has its own train station which is walking distance to our proposed event. We are actually within the Casey Council and Cardinia Shire regions, which actually accounts for 8% of Victoria's total population - so although you might think it is in the middle of nowhere, there is more than enough people around to warrant an event of this nature out our way.

I can appreciate your view that we are amateurs. This would be our first eSports event BUT not our first major event. We had a festival just last weekend with just over 30,000 in attendance over 2 days. We run regular events of this nature, from generic sporting events to music festivals and community engagement.

I would love to hear any further feedback you have on how we can assure you of our capacity to deliver an event of this nature, and have even updated the survey to include a feedback section at the end - where you can identify this conversation and I can reach out to you personally and seek your advice - if you wanted that.

> Before we lay down tens of thousands of dollars to get this event up and running I need to convince my board to approve it - hence, cannot provide you with more information on the event until I have a concrete yes.

Advertise the type of activities that will be available. On the survey, all i see is  you asking for $$$$. But still, what am i buying into. Are the seat comfortable? What else is there to do, aside from watching an esport cinema experience,  ETC...

> which actually accounts for 8% of Victoria's total population - so although you might think it is in the middle of nowhere, there is **more than enough people around** to warrant an event of this nature out our way.

1st. It doesn't seem like you are catering for people that is from the outer state. 

2nd. I don't mean out of no where as in,there isn't enough employees to run the operation. I meant, why should people go out of their way to an area with insufficient points of interest. And if it is interesting, i don't see any of it being mentioned.

3rd. If the 8% you're referring to as potential customer. Then i would have to tell you the numbers of people that play league wouldn't made up 1% of it, and those that would even go the above and beyond to attend the event is even less.

4th. Read some marketing tips. Make your product attractive, then ask for people's interest and THEN $$$. 

All you are doing is hoping league as a game will sell itself. I haven't seen anything worth buying at this point.

>  We had a festival just last weekend with just over 30,000 in attendance over 2 days.

Cite some source please. I'll look forward to reviewing it. 30,000 IN ATTENDANCE. wow. Am impress "If it is true".

Dragmah. I'm looking to do something similar in Sydney.

Would you like to discuss how best to move forward? Basically, our goals are very similar, but I'm yet to formulate any kind of plan.

Would like to talk to you and move forward with haste. Please email me: businessofleague@outlook.com.
